feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Coastal Flood Warning issued September 19 at 9:58AM AKDT until September 19 at 4:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM AKDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Significant coastal flooding expected. * WHERE...Western Arctic Coast. * WHEN...Until 4 PM AKDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Low lying areas near the coast will be inundated.

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued September 19 at 2:17AM AKDT until September 20 at 6:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH 6 AM AKDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...South winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 55 mph expected. * WHERE...Near Eastern Alaska Range Passes. * WHEN...Until 6 AM AKDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 18 at 2:30PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water Levels Through Tuesday... Water levels on rivers and streams have risen sharply on the Seward Peninsula and in the western Brooks Range, as the remnants of typhoon Merbok tracked northeastward through the Bering Strait and Chukchi Sea. Between 1 to 3 inches of rain have fallen so far with an additional 1 to 2 inches possible through Monday night in
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys

entry.title: Flash Flood Watch issued September 19 at 10:20AM PDT until September 20 at 12:00AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE LNU LIGHTNING COMPLEX BURN SCAR IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall are possible over the LNU Lightning Complex burn scar. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following area, Southern Sacramento Valley.

entry.summary: ...Cold and Wet Through Wednesday... * An early season storm will continue bringing well below normal temperatures and chances for rain, and even some snow for elevations above 9000 feet, through Wednesday. A few thunderstorms will be possible each afternoon as well, with a 10% chance for a stray nocturnal storm Tuesday night. While

entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Berkshire County through 400 PM EDT... At 330 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sandisfield, or 14 miles north of Torrington, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued September 19 at 11:20AM EDT until September 23 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Lake and Volusia Counties. For the St. Johns River...including Astor...Minor flooding is forecast. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 1100 AM EDT.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 19 at 7:51AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Record High Temperatures Expected Monday and Tuesday... Monday and Tuesday will bring much warmer than average temperatures for mid September. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 19 at 2:17AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Gusty south winds expected through Tuesday... A slow moving, strong low pressure system off of the northern California coast will bring gusty south winds to much of Nevada this afternoon as well as Tuesday. South winds will increase this afternoon reaching speeds of 20 to 25 mph with gusts around 35 mph. The highest winds will be located across the US-50 corridor
